intro: Narcissus leonensis, commonly known as the Spanish daffodil, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that allow it to survive in adverse conditions. Narcissus leonensis blooms in spring, adding a vibrant splash of color to gardens and natural habitats.
